intro: Pleroma strigosum, commonly known as the rough pleuroma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. Its flowers are typically clustered in umbels and feature five petals, with the lower one being prominently hooded. Pleroma strigosum is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
